ca.mcgill.ecse211.mountev3rest.sensor

Class LightPoller

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.mountev3rest.sensor.LightPoller

  • public class LightPoller
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides an interface for accessing the light readings of three light sensors on request.

    The class is implemented as a singleton to facilitate access to the sensors to different parts of the code. Additionally, the LightPoller class also provides line detection for the left and right sensors.

    • Field Detail

      • front

        public float[] front
        Front light sensor reading. Since this sensor is in RGB mode this is a three element array with the corresponding values.

      • left

        public float[] left
        Left light sensor reading. This is a one element sample containing a Red value only.

      • right

        public float[] right
        Right light sensor reading. This is a one element sample containing a Red value only.

      • frontMean

        public float[] frontMean
        Mean of the last three readings of the front light sensor.

      • leftMean

        public float[] leftMean
        Mean of the last three readings of the left light sensor.

      • rightMean

        public float[] rightMean
        Mean of the last three readings of the right light sensor.

      • leftInLine

        public boolean leftInLine
        Indicates whether the left light sensor is currently seeing a line.

      • rightInLine

        public boolean rightInLine
        Indicates whether the right light sensor is currently seeing a line.

    • Method Detail

      • getLightPoller

        public static LightPoller getLightPoller(EV3ColorSensor frontSensor,
                                         EV3ColorSensor leftSensor,
                                         EV3ColorSensor rightSensor)
        Creates a LightPoller instance if the class has not been instantiated, otherwise returns the existing instance. This method is the factory method for the singleton LightPoller class.
        Parameters:
        frontSensor - Light sensor placed on the robot arm, set to RGB mode.
        leftSensor - Light sensor placed to the left of the robot's center, set to Red mode.
        rightSensor - Light sensor placed to the right of the robot's center, set to Red mode.
        Returns:
        New or existing instance of the LightPoller object.

      • getLightPoller

        public static LightPoller getLightPoller()
                                  throws PollerException
        Factory method for existing instance of the singleton LightPoller class.
        Returns:
        Existing LightPoller object.
        Throws:
        PollerException - If the LightPoller class has not been instantiated.

      • poll

        public void poll()
